nodes.label: Geometric Constructions
nodes.title: The process of drawing geometric shapes, angles, and lines accurately using specific tools and methods.

nodes.label: Dynamic Geometry Software
nodes.title: Computer programs that allow users to create and manipulate geometric constructions interactively.

nodes.label: Precision in Geometric Constructions
nodes.title: The use of accurate measurements and tools to ensure exactness in geometric drawings.

nodes.label: Use of Compass
nodes.title: Employing a compass to draw circles or arcs with a given radius.

nodes.label: Use of Straight Edge
nodes.title: Using a straight edge to draw straight lines without measurement.

nodes.label: Use of Ruler
nodes.title: Using a ruler to draw straight lines and measure lengths.

nodes.label: Use of Protractor
nodes.title: Using a protractor to measure and draw angles.

nodes.label: Use of Set Square
nodes.title: Employing a set square to draw perpendicular or parallel lines and specific angles (usually 30°, 45°, 60°, and 90°).

nodes.label: Drawing a Circle of Given Radius
nodes.title: Constructing a circle with a specified radius using a compass.

nodes.label: Application of Constructions in Real-Life Contexts
nodes.title: Using geometric constructions to solve practical problems or model real-world situations.

nodes.label: Cartesian Coordinate Plane
nodes.title: A two-dimensional plane defined by a horizontal axis (x-axis) and a vertical axis (y-axis) used to plot points, lines, and curves.

nodes.label: Plotting Points
nodes.title: The process of marking a point on the coordinate plane using an ordered pair (x, y).

nodes.label: Linear Relationship
nodes.title: A relationship between two variables that forms a straight line when graphed; can be described by a linear equation.

nodes.label: Tabular Representation of Linear Relationships
nodes.title: Using tables to show corresponding values of variables in a linear relationship.

nodes.label: Graphical Representation of Linear Relationships
nodes.title: Using graphs to represent linear relationships between two variables.

nodes.label: Slope of a Line
nodes.title: A measure of the steepness of a line, representing the rate of change between two variables.

nodes.label: Rate of Change
nodes.title: The amount by which one quantity changes with respect to another; in linear relationships, this is equivalent to the slope.

nodes.label: Y-intercept (Start Value)
nodes.title: The point where a line crosses the y-axis, representing the initial value in a linear relationship.

nodes.label: Intersection Point of Two Lines
nodes.title: The point at which two linear graphs meet, representing the solution to a system of two linear equations.

nodes.label: Solving Systems of Two Linear Equations
nodes.title: Finding the values of variables that satisfy two linear equations simultaneously, often by graphical, numeric, or mental strategies.

nodes.label: right-angled triangle
nodes.title: A triangle in which one of the angles is exactly 90 degrees.

nodes.label: Pythagoras' theorem
nodes.title: A theorem stating that in a right-angled triangle, the square of the hypotenuse equals the sum of the squares of the other two sides.

nodes.label: application of Pythagoras' theorem
nodes.title: Using Pythagoras' theorem to solve problems involving unknown side lengths in right-angled triangles.

nodes.label: trigonometric ratios
nodes.title: Ratios of the lengths of sides in a right-angled triangle, specifically sine, cosine, and tangent.

nodes.label: solving right-angled triangle problems
nodes.title: Finding unknown side lengths or angles in right-angled triangles using trigonometric ratios and Pythagoras' theorem.

nodes.label: real-world applications of trigonometry
nodes.title: Using trigonometric ratios to solve practical problems involving heights, distances, and angles.

nodes.label: solving problems involving heights and distances
nodes.title: Applying trigonometric ratios and Pythagoras' theorem to determine unknown heights or distances in real-life contexts.

nodes.label: Translation
nodes.title: A transformation that moves every point of a shape the same distance in the same direction.

nodes.label: Central Symmetry
nodes.title: A transformation where each point and its image are on opposite sides of a central point and at equal distances from it.

nodes.label: Axial Symmetry
nodes.title: A transformation in which a figure is mapped onto itself by reflection over a line (axis of symmetry).

nodes.label: Rotation
nodes.title: A transformation that turns a figure about a fixed point through a given angle and direction.

nodes.label: Enlargement
nodes.title: A transformation that changes the size of a figure by a scale factor relative to a fixed point (center of enlargement).

nodes.label: Centre of Enlargement
nodes.title: The fixed point in the plane about which all points are expanded or contracted during an enlargement.

nodes.label: Scale Factor (k)
nodes.title: The ratio by which the size of a figure is increased or decreased during an enlargement, where k > 0 and k ∈ Q.

nodes.label: Effect of Enlargement on Area
nodes.title: Understanding how the area of a shape changes when the shape is enlarged by a scale factor.

nodes.label: Axis of Symmetry
nodes.title: A line that divides a figure into two mirror-image halves.

nodes.label: Recognising Images under Transformation
nodes.title: Identifying the result of applying a transformation (translation, symmetry, rotation) to a point or object.

nodes.label: Solving Problems Involving Enlargements
nodes.title: Applying knowledge of enlargement, center of enlargement, and scale factor to solve geometric problems.

nodes.label: synthetic geometry
nodes.title: A branch of geometry that relies on axioms, theorems, and logical reasoning rather than coordinates or algebraic methods.

nodes.label: geometric construction
nodes.title: The process of drawing geometric figures using only a compass and straightedge, following specific steps.

nodes.label: construction 16-21
nodes.title: Specific geometric constructions as outlined in the curriculum, likely involving constructing particular shapes, angles, or figures.

nodes.label: construction 22
nodes.title: A particular geometric construction task specified in the curriculum, requiring compass and straightedge techniques.

nodes.label: theorem
nodes.title: A mathematical statement that has been proven to be true using deductive reasoning and logical arguments.

nodes.label: proof
nodes.title: A logical argument demonstrating the truth of a mathematical statement, based on axioms and previously established theorems.

nodes.label: axiom
nodes.title: A fundamental statement or proposition in mathematics accepted as true without proof, serving as a starting point for further reasoning.

nodes.label: corollary
nodes.title: A statement that follows readily from a previously proven theorem.

nodes.label: converse
nodes.title: A statement formed by reversing the hypothesis and conclusion of a given conditional statement.

nodes.label: implies
nodes.title: A logical relationship where the truth of one statement guarantees the truth of another.

nodes.label: is equivalent to
nodes.title: A logical relationship indicating that two statements are true under exactly the same conditions.

nodes.label: if and only if
nodes.title: A logical connector indicating that two statements are both necessary and sufficient for each other.

nodes.label: proof by contradiction
nodes.title: A method of proof in which the negation of the statement to be proved is assumed, leading to a contradiction.

nodes.label: theorem 7
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem referenced in the curriculum (details in the source text).

nodes.label: theorem 8
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem referenced in the curriculum (details in the source text).

nodes.label: theorem 11
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem concerning ratios, foundational for the proof of the Pythagorean theorem.

nodes.label: theorem 12
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem concerning ratios, foundational for the proof of the Pythagorean theorem.

nodes.label: theorem 13
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem concerning ratios, foundational for the proof of the Pythagorean theorem.

nodes.label: theorem 16
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem referenced in the curriculum (details in the source text).

nodes.label: theorem 17
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem referenced in the curriculum (details in the source text).

nodes.label: theorem 18
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem referenced in the curriculum (details in the source text).

nodes.label: theorem 20
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem referenced in the curriculum (details in the source text).

nodes.label: theorem 21
nodes.title: A specific geometric theorem referenced in the curriculum (details in the source text).

nodes.label: corollary 6
nodes.title: A specific corollary referenced in the curriculum (details in the source text).

nodes.label: ratios in geometry
nodes.title: The use of proportional relationships between lengths, areas, or other quantities in geometric figures.

nodes.label: theorem of Pythagoras
nodes.title: A fundamental theorem in geometry stating that in a right triangle, the square of the hypotenuse equals the sum of the squares of the other two sides.

nodes.label: Parallel Lines via Slopes
nodes.title: Two lines are parallel if and only if their slopes are equal.

nodes.label: Perpendicular Lines via Slopes
nodes.title: Two lines are perpendicular if and only if the product of their slopes is -1.

nodes.label: Linear Equation in Two Variables
nodes.title: An equation of the form ax + by + c = 0, representing a straight line in the coordinate plane.

nodes.label: Solving Problems Involving Slopes
nodes.title: Applying the concept of slope to solve geometric and algebraic problems involving lines.

nodes.label: Area of a Triangle (Coordinate Geometry)
nodes.title: Calculating the area of a triangle given the coordinates of its vertices, often using the determinant formula.

nodes.label: Equation of a Circle (Standard Form)
nodes.title: The equation (x-h)^2 + (y-k)^2 = r^2 represents all points (x, y) at a distance r from the center (h, k).

nodes.label: Solving Problems Involving a Line and a Circle (Center at Origin)
nodes.title: Finding points of intersection, tangency, or other relationships between a line and a circle with center (0, 0).

nodes.label: Perpendicular Distance from a Point to a Line
nodes.title: Calculating the shortest distance from a given point to a specified line in the plane.

nodes.label: Angle Between Two Lines
nodes.title: Finding the angle formed at the intersection of two lines using their slopes.

nodes.label: Internal Division of a Line Segment
nodes.title: Dividing a line segment into a given ratio m:n internally, and finding the coordinates of the dividing point.

nodes.label: Equation of a Circle (General Form)
nodes.title: The equation x^2 + y^2 + 2gx + 2fy + c = 0 represents a circle with center (-g, -f) and radius sqrt(g^2 + f^2 - c).

nodes.label: Solving Problems Involving a Line and a Circle
nodes.title: Analyzing the relationships, intersections, and tangency conditions between a line and a circle in the coordinate plane.

nodes.label: Pythagoras' Theorem in 2D
nodes.title: Using the Pythagorean theorem to solve problems involving right-angled triangles in two dimensions.

nodes.label: Trigonometric Area of a Triangle
nodes.title: Calculating the area of a triangle using trigonometric formulas, such as (1/2)ab sin C.

nodes.label: Sine Rule
nodes.title: Using the sine rule to solve for unknown sides or angles in non-right-angled triangles.

nodes.label: Cosine Rule
nodes.title: Using the cosine rule to solve for unknown sides or angles in non-right-angled triangles.

nodes.label: Definition of sin θ and cos θ for all θ
nodes.title: Defining the sine and cosine functions for all real values of θ, including negative and angles greater than 360°.

nodes.label: Definition of tan θ
nodes.title: Defining the tangent function for all values of θ where it is defined.

nodes.label: Area of a Sector of a Circle
nodes.title: Calculating the area of a sector of a circle using angle and radius.

nodes.label: Length of an Arc
nodes.title: Finding the length of an arc of a circle given the radius and the angle.

nodes.label: Trigonometric Ratios in Surd Form
nodes.title: Expressing trigonometric ratios using surds (irrational roots) rather than decimals.

nodes.label: 3D Trigonometric Problem Solving
nodes.title: Applying trigonometry to solve problems in three-dimensional contexts.

nodes.label: Graphing Sine, Cosine, and Tangent Functions
nodes.title: Plotting the graphs of the basic trigonometric functions over a range of values.

nodes.label: Graphing Transformed Trigonometric Functions
nodes.title: Graphing functions of the form f(θ) = a + b sin(cθ) and g(θ) = a + b cos(cθ) for real parameters a, b, c.

nodes.label: Solving Trigonometric Equations
nodes.title: Solving equations involving trigonometric functions, such as sin(nθ) = 0 and cos(nθ) = 1/2, and finding all possible solutions.

nodes.label: Radian Measure of Angles
nodes.title: Using radians as a unit of angular measure instead of degrees.

nodes.label: Derivation of Trigonometric Formulae
nodes.title: Proving or deriving key trigonometric identities and formulas.

nodes.label: Application of Trigonometric Formulae
nodes.title: Applying a range of trigonometric identities and formulas to solve problems.

nodes.label: enlargement (transformation geometry)
nodes.title: A transformation that increases or decreases the size of a geometric figure while preserving its shape and the proportions of its sides.

nodes.label: scale factor of enlargement
nodes.title: A number k that determines how much a figure is enlarged or reduced in an enlargement transformation; if 0 < k < 1, the figure is reduced, and if k > 1, the figure is enlarged.

nodes.label: rational scale factor
nodes.title: A scale factor k for enlargement where k is a rational number (k ∈ Q), meaning it can be expressed as a ratio of two integers.

nodes.label: problem solving with enlargements
nodes.title: Applying knowledge of enlargement transformations, including centre and scale factor, to solve geometric problems.
